intro: Scaphochlamys endauensis, commonly known as the Endau river orchid, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Peninsular Malaysia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its intricate, delicate floral structure. The plant produces showy, fragrant flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and is often found growing on tree trunks or branches. Due to habitat loss, Scaphochlamys endauensis is considered endangered and is of significant interest to botanists and conservationists.
